summary:
Graduated of Paris I Panthéon Sorbonne university with two masters degrees in International Relations and Political Science, I worked as a consultant on civil society empowerment projects in West Africa, then as a campaigner at Peuples Solidaires - ActionAid France.
From 2009 to 2012, I developed the online global citizen movement Avaaz.org in France, working on web mobilizations, fundraising and advocacy.
In March 2012, I joined the Change.org platform to launch and run the French branch which now has more than 13 million users. In december 2014, I was appointed Country Director for Change.org France.
In April 2018, I joined the ONE Campaign as Global Campaigns Director to lead a team of global campaigners helping our supporters around the world win more campaigns in the fight against extreme poverty and preventable disease.
headline: Senior Director, Global Campaigns - The ONE Campaign

experience.description:
- leading a global team of campaigners to develop, manage and execute ONE's campaigns
- coordinating campaign community of practice and excellence through the use of ONE's campaign accelerator and supporter engagement strategy
- collaborating with ONE’s offices around the world to help innovate and improve ONE’s campaigning efforts
- overseeing the production, quality control and evaluation of campaign plans and content
- increasing thought leadership on campaigning within and outside ONE
experience.title: Senior Director, Global Campaigns

experience.description:
- leading a global team of campaigners developing and managing global and national campaigns with ONE’s offices around the world
- coordinating the development of campaign strategy and tactics
- overseeing the production and quality control of campaign plans and contents
- managing larget budgets and strategic partnerships
- developing member acquisition and retention strategies
experience.title: Global Campaigns Director

experience.description:
- Team leader: managing 7 persons and providing clarity and focus around team’s strategy and objectives
- Representing Change.org in France externally and developing high level contacts in politics, business, PR agencies, the media and civil society 
- Speaker and trainer on people power campaigning and digital democracy
- Supporting global expansion: as a senior member of the international team, involved in cross-country and cross-functional strategic projects (Revenue, Product, Campaigns, Partnerships)
experience.title: Country Director, France

experience.description:
- First staffer in France, launch of the Change.org site in French, team recruitment, networking with stakeholders
- Support to platform users (citizens, non-profit) in their campaigns to gather support and influence French decision-makers (government, corporate) on most popular causes in France (education, environment, social justice, human rights, animals)
- Development of creative online/offline campaign tactics and innovative PR/communications activities as part of our empowerment tools and resources for users
experience.title: Campaigns Director, France

experience.description:
- Drafting compelling campaign materials and executing campaign plans.
- Consulting with experts and partners to develop strategies and advocacy work strategy, policy, and message.
- Conducting high-level advocacy and relationship building with government, media and civil society in France and Europe
experience.title: Global Campaigner

education.degreeName: Master's degree in development and international cooperation

volunteer.description:
Le Mouvement is the French member of the Online Progressive Engagement Network (https://www.the-open.net/). My duties and role as Chairperson of the Board (or "Président de l'Association) are the following:
- Lead the Board: regular reviews of the organization’s vision and mission; engage the board, staff, and stakeholders in strategic planning processes; facilitate meetings; 
- Ensure accountability and sustainability: networking and fundraising; regular resource audits to ensure the organization has the financial, human, and material resources needed to fulfill  its mission
- Support and Supervise the Executive Director: work as  “co-captains” of the organization on campaigns, strategy, fundraising, recruitment; serve as a sounding board and support system for the ED
